comment: The genuine Samsung Evo Select line of Micro SD cards are great. They are reliable and they live up to the speed and capacity classifications they claim to. I've been using Samsung cards for years and they are the only brand that consistently doesn't give me any issues year after year.This 32GB card is no exception. However, by default the card is formatted as FAT32, but I prefer exFAT as FAT32 won't allow you to transfer a folder containing more than 4GB to the card. That's annoying if you are moving data from an old card to a new one. FAT32 has 4GB file size limitations, but on a transfer it recognizes a directory containing lots of files as 1 thing, and applies the 4GB limit. This will give you an error (in Windows anyway) that there isn't enough space available for the transfer. But if you copy the files individually it works fine. Or just format the card to exFAT and it will accept the folder that exceeds 4GB easily. exFAT will work just fine in an Android phone as well (Android 5.1 or higher. Earlier versions may have some issues with the exFAT formatting)

Another user review points out that their 128GB Samsung EVO Select card is only rated for 60MB/s write speeds.If you look under the "From the manufacturer" part of the product description with the 64GB version of the card selected you will see that it states that it is rated for write speeds up to 20MB/s.

You should be very careful when buying SD cards online. One way I knew this listing was legitimate was by checking the merchant during order review, mine showed as "Amazon.com Services LLC".Upon arrival I checked the packaging which had no misprints, and the micro SD card graphics were crisp and had white sides, the model number on the packaging also matched the model written on the card's backside, all pointing to a legitimate item.
Died days after installing it in phone. Looking at the reviews, it seems to happen occasionally. Hopefully the replacement will be better
Why new version is just 60M?Old version is up to 90M？

All the Samsung EVO cards are UHS-3 except for the one EVO 32Gb version, where a quick sleight of hand is made to UHS-1.  But that should be easy to spot, right...?  No, because the cards as listed confuse two different ratings - designated on the card by a Roman Numeral (usually a 'I') and a number placed inside a 'U'.  The number in the U is the cards' UHS rating, the former it's type - if you have a jeweler's loupe, you can see what they are on the card.The listings have all the cards as UHS-I, which, if you don't know prior to purchasing, they've mixed things up.  The cards are all Type I and UHS-3...except for the 32Gb, which is UHS-1.

It apeares as if the SD card was removed from the packaging and replaced. Update : SD card was clearly damaged and it clearly explains why it was repackaged.
I only buy Samsung SD cards.  I verify them all with Samsung's software called "Samsung Memory Card/UFD Authentication Utility."  This is a review for the 128GB EVO Select.

I tell you what, I remember a time when a 128GB micro SD card used to cost 100 smackaroos! These EVO cards are Samsung's economical line, and can be bought for only 20 smackaroo's. With average read times around 90MBPS, and write times around 50MBPS, these are most certainly great for 1080P HD. And because of their high performance, they are obviously great for taking pictures as well.However, these cards are not really rated for 4K. If you need a card for 4K, you need one that has closer to 150MBPS read and 90-100MPBS write. This is because 4K is very demanding on hardware. And now that people are starting to talk about 8K, the hardware demands go up even higher still.
I use this in my Raspberry Pi 2B.I was overclocking, and had unplugged the RPi after a lock-up, which caused damage to the card.

Bought two of these 32gig 'Select' cards for a dashcam and a GoPro. 1080p video playback of moving objects is slightly jerky. Tested each card with H2testw. Maximum read speed was 15.6 mb/s, maximum write speed was 15.2 mb/s. That's an unusual result. Expected at least two mb/s difference in r/w performance. No errors reported, storage capacity was right on. Product description states "up tp 95 mb/s read speed" Guaranteed minimum speed of 30mb/s puts the card into the next speed rating. Very misleading advertisement. Still, these cards are faster than the minimum r/w speeds of 10 mb/s they are  rated for. Good enough for an old cell phone or cheap point and shoot camera.

Tablet kept saying it was corrupted and refused to do anything with it.  Could not get my PC to read it either.  Finally put it in another tablet which allowed me to format it finally.  Put it back in the tablet it was bought for.... says it's a 64 GB that's half full...  whaaaaaaa?I have no idea what the deal is with this thing honestly.  This was supposed to go in the tablet that was a Mother's Day gift.  I did get it to accept pictures finally, but I don't have a lot of faith it won't fail and I have no reason why it says it's half full when it had just been formatted.  Doesn't make a bit of sense.  I'm sure I will be replacing it.  Since it came late, I went ahead and sent the tablet to my mother and I will deal with the failure later.

I buy a lot of Samsung EVO MicroSD Cards of various sizes (32GB, 64GB, 128GB, etc.) & haven't had any issues yet. I use them in phones, Raspberry PI projects, cameras, Nintendo Switch, chromebooks, etc.On Amazon Prime Day I recently purchased another Samsung EVO 32GB. I always use CrystalDiskMark to check the speeds of cards to help make sure they're real and not fake. The read speed of this new card was 20 MB/s & writing speed was 30 MB/s - which was way off! After repeating the tests a few times, I figured I got my first bad card.

I recently got a Galaxy S20+ and wanted to take advantage of the ability to add a large storage Micro-SD card to upgrade the phone's standard 128GB internal storage.It wasn't that many years ago that 8-GB was A-LOT! Nowadays the phones operating systems take up way more than 8-GB just for that!

It arrived on time. It works fine. But, storage capacity is less than stated. It states 128gb, it actually has 119.2gb. I have learned that all manufacturers are ripping off the consumers. Samsung ripped me off for 8.8gb!Virtually every storage device manufacturer defines 1KB=1000 bytes, 1MB=1,000,000 bytes, and 1GB=1,000,000,000 bytes. The fine print on the packaging indicates this. Let's call these "marketing" GB. Technically, however, 1KB=1024 bytes, 1MB=1,048,576 bytes (1024*1024), and 1GB=1,073,741,824 bytes (1024*1024*1024). Computer operating systems will use the more correct technical values when calculating sizes. Thus, when you divide 128,000,000,000 (Samsung's advertised capacity) by 1,073,741,824, you get just over 119GB. The packaging's fine print also indicates "Actual user storage less", which explains the difference between the calculated 119GB and actual 118GB. The playing field is level among manufacturers because nearly all of them use the same practice, but it requires the consumer to be aware of it when looking for a device of a particular actual capacity. For example, since file sizes are reported using actual values, users will need to convert between "marketing" capacities and actual capacities to ensure they're getting a device large enough to hold the desired files. As always, caveat emptor "BUYER BEWARE"!

Its very fast as everything download and store on it fast.  My friend suggest to purchase the evo plus but i find this more valuable to the bucks i spent.

Just got this card (sold from and shipped by Amazon), packaging all look genuine. I tested the 128 GB card with Blackmagic Disk Speed Test repeatedly, and the 128 GB card maxes out at just under 90 MB/s read and just over 60 MB/s write. Screenshot attached. If you want the higher write speeds, you need to jump up to the 256 GB card.

Although the Samsung Galaxy S20 has 128GB of on-board storage, it also has a Micro SD Card slot...so why not add one. I did some research and discovered the Samsung EVO Select microSDXC was recommended by several on-line Android sites. This card was probably the best for me. I didn't want or need to run any apps from the card, just for storage of photos, videos and files. It installed easily in about 2 minutes (there are youtube videos for install, setup and moving files). 128GB card I purchased doubled my storage area. I've moved all my photos and video, plus set up my camera to store all newly generated photos and video to the SD card.
So far so good on this micro sD card.This is the third micro sD card I’ve bought for my phones since October 2015.

SKEPTICAL is what I was about the advertised read & write speeds of the Samsung 125GB EVo Select micro SD card.THE TEST. Put the 128GB in a USB adapter and stuck that into my desktop PC which runs Windows 10  with a 4Ghz Intel processor on an ASRock Z370 motherboard and proceeded to use AOMEI Partition Assistant to clone 54GB of data from a backup Samsung 840 Pro SSD. WOW! The transfer was faster than ANY thumb drive or anything else I've ever plugged into a USB port.
The new 64gb version is no longer a 90 MB/s rated card. Packaging comes with stickers "covering" the printed specifications on the packaging for the previous version.

I tried to install this SD Memory card  in my newly factory reconditioned Samsung Galaxy S9+ and the phone was unable to read the card, To double check I installed the card into my Galaxy S8 and again the card was not recognized.I returned the card to Amazon for a refund and purchased an upgrade to the Samsung 256GB EVO Plus Class 10 UHS-I microSDXC U3 with Adapter (MB-MC256GA) which cost $44.50 on Amazon.

It just went out. I contacted cs and was given the runaround and then on a phone call was told I didn't need an RMA#, like a ticket #. Not for their cards. So 3 months after all this back and forth I send it in as told. Several months later I never heard back. Now I'm going back and forth again and nobody wants to help without an RMA#!!!! They keep trying to close my ticket, but they don't know I have saved EVERY message! I have repeatedly demanded a manager but I keep getting blown off. ALL I WANT IS A REPLACEMENT CARD!!!!!!!!

I'm not real well versed on memory cards and did find this "Ultra Fast" but too slow Samsung card a bit disappointing.
I don't know why some people gave that product a 1 star but the card is really good. I'm using it for my Samsung galaxy a51 phone and it works great

I guess I’m going to have to stop buying electronics and electronic accessories on Amazon because you have no way of knowing whether you’ll get a real product or a fake. The real memory card (on the left) has a write speed of three times that of the fake memory card (on the right). They’ve also altered the packaging by putting labels over the printing to mask the 4K UHD video video speeds achievable with an ‘actual’ Samsung card. Notice that the model numbers on both are identical.I’ll be returning this and notifying Amazon of the fakes being sold as actual Samsung cards.
I cannot select zero stars or less.Product is a P.O.S!!

Pay attention to the label.  I have the 64GB version and its 5 stars in every way.  I bought the 64GB version because its U3.  So naturally seing the same type of card in 32GB version I would assume it was a U3.  Its not.  That said, I tested it in my panasonic GX85 and it recorded 4k video for 10 minutes without issue.  So my guess is that the performance is still there hence the 4 star rating.  I bought these for use as internal memory in my moto e4.  (Trying to keep the price down, but performance up).Next time for only $8 more its better to just get the 64GB version.

So I bought this from Amazon and it tested good. Speed tests were OK but not great. Writes were 25 to 30 MB/s and reads averaged 70 MB/s. I had to put this card in a USB adapter to test it on my desktop PC.

I don't understand how Samsung can sell this 32GB micro SD card for the insanely low price of $12.99?! No complaints from me, as this card is perfect for adding more space to your smart phone, tablet, digital camera, etc. This card has lightning fast transfer speeds, boasting 95mbps and 20mbps write and read speeds respectfully. This card is compatible with all micro SD devices and regular SD devices with the included card adapter. With an extra 32GB of storage, you no longer have to worry about your memory running low, so feel free to add or install whatever apps, movies, songs and anything else your heart desires. The card also offers 4 point protection, keeping all your data safe from water and other environmental hazards. Just make sure your device can accept the 32GB storage expansion and then you are good to go! I don't know how my phone got along without this card before I got it, I highly recommend you consider this card as well.

I've generally had good luck with Samsung memory and drives. Got this one as expandable storage for Microsoft Surface pro 7 tablet.It doesn't have the highest advertised speed rating, but since data transfer rates are limited within the device, this drive makes for sense. I also didn't go for the competition because I've had two structural failures within last year on SanDisk and Lexar memory cards.

I bought the Samsung MicroSD EVO Select for my GoPro Hero 5 Black, despite not being on the approved list. Sadly, this only includes a very few select cards. All of which cost more than this one. I also have a Lexar 633X, which is supported, and that I've provided as a comparison for some read/write tests.In the pic attached to this review, I've provided screenshots of both cards' CrystalDiskMark benchmark. As one can see, read speeds are near as makes no difference. Write speeds, on the other hand, clearly tilt to the Samsung EVO's favor. It's almost twice as fast as the Lexar 633x SDHC card. Worth noting, is that both of these cards were tested in the same USB 3.0 port.

One of the best storage solutions in the industry. Fast, consistent, and reliable. Works on just about all micro SD compatible devices such as, raspberry pi, Nintendo Switch, and most Android phones. Also works well in dash cam applications. If you need Micro SD storage look no further.

Took a gamble on a larger micro-sd card being compatible with a Huawei M3 mediapad. No information anywhere on the internet saying this device would support a 256gb micro-sd card. Fortunately this one works, and with Samsung’s reliability, speeds and the good price I paid for it, once I transferred all the files from the 128gb card to this new 256gb micro-sd card and then installed it back into the Mediapad, everything now works really well after testing, I am now tempted to try a 512gb card, but I should just put the brakes on that and be happy with this one being recognized by the Mediapad m3, since I wasn’t expecting it to work in the first place.

I have a few Wyze cams in my apartment, and while I love the cloud-recorded little snippets of video, occasionally I wanted to be able to view a longer recording.  I'd avoided buying the micro-SD cards that Wyze sells, simply because I tend to avoid spending money whenever possible, but I finally gave up on that thriftiness for convenience's sake.This little 32gb card is exactly what I needed for my cam, and it records all day long for me.  I can check the video when I need to figure out what made my dog start suddenly barking (at home alone while I'm at work), or even scroll back to check what time I came in from dropping off a load of laundry.  For my use, this little card is a great value.

I'm surprised how much space is allocated the sd card only has 244gbs free to use a loss of 12gbs. Also the writing speed on my computer shows only 14.9mb/s significantly different from the 90- 100mb/s. I tested the device with a free program. And will attach the image to my review.
I have several Samsung smartcams that require micro sd cards and Samsung memory products have for me had the widest range of compatibility.These cards are working flawlessly in this application.

I've read a lot of these are being bootlegged and ripped off. Where your device will read it's 128Gb or whatever size you buy but in reality they just program it to say something it's not. Sometimes it will be a 16Gb when it read 256Gb or what have you. Supposedly these two tone cartridges are more expensive to to rip off so they are the safer bet to buy. It cost the bootleggers more to create a two tone case than an all black or all white one. I didn't test this one as I got it and opened it while in my car so I stuck it straight into my dash cam and it read 128Gb but whether or not it's real its programmed to say that. I will later on take it inside to my PC and run a test on it to verify it's legit. So for reasons for this review I'm saying it's legit and worth every penny. These have become so much cheaper over the years. It's mind blowing how much data you can hold on such a small device. Gotta love technology.

I tried and tried to get it to read and recognize this Samsung EVO 512 SDXC card. I was about to return it but decided to try another card and the Switch didn’t recognize that card either. Ended up trying 5 different cards. So I had to return the Switch but I kept the card. Got lucky again and found another switch 2 days later and the card worked perfectly. Tons of storage and plenty of speed for games to function flawlessly.

As of 19 Oct 2019 they're still doing their job for each device.My only complaint isn't about the Samsung memory card but all devices I have. I bought the SD cards for extra storage &they provide that IF the device OS & all the preinstalled extra bloatware most devices add on  that really have nothing to do with how the device operates, allowed the SD card really provide the extra storage. The unwanted bloatware I can't delete & so many apps will not let you move them to the SD card, so they sit on the device. I have so much unused space on all the memory cards I have it's crazy, yet I always get one, just in case it's needed someday. There are a lot of Micro storage devices on the market and I am glad I went with the name brand.  I use this in my dash cam.  The cam company recommended Samsung or SanDisk.  I look through a ton of options and the Samsung was in the same price range as the no named ones so I went with it.  could not be happier.  I also was not aware of the U rating on SD cards.  The cam needed a U3 - the one I had at home was a U1.  Apparently it matters because the U1 would not work in my dash cam.  Just an FYI if you are buying a card make sure it has the rating you are need.

They work fine everywhere else. I'd blame the cameras but i can use any other brand micro sd cards and they work perfectly. Currently using Walmart brand and no problems at all.

I used this card in my Mavic 2 Zoom drone and I have no problems with the 4K video recording and the reason I thought I would try in my dashcam.I have found that they are not designed to stand up to the rigors of the continual recording and re-writing of a security camera or dashcam and advise not to be used in these applications.

I never thought I'd buy another Samsung product again, but I figured I'd try out my luck.  I was pleasantly surprised!  For my testing I use two MicroSD cards:SanDisk Extreme 64GB microSDXC UHS-I (SDSQXNE-064G-GN6MA)

If you are spending the money on a nice new drone and want to take advantage of all the fancy features and video recording you definitely need to get a microSD card that can keep up and deliver the speeds and quality you need. My first flight I used what I thought was a fast enough microSD card that I got for a great price from Sandisk but as my videos showed afterwards it just wasn't able to keep up with dropped frames, choppy video, and missed shots.4k video with HDR and RAW photos need quite a bit of raw bandwidth and you absolutely should invest in a quality microSD card like this one. I'm sure there are a lot of brands out there to choose from but if you can pick this one up on a sale it will definitely come through for 4K video capture and anything you need for a modern prosumer drone and I imagine video camera too.

I was in search of a storage option for my Nintendo Switch after I had quickly run out of the onboard capacity of the actual system. The price to storage ratio of this micro SD card compared to others on Amazon is almost unrivaled. Although there may be slightly cheaper options, they don't come from a reputable company like Samsung and I would steer clear of those. In terms of brand name products with this amount of storage for the price, I am very satisfied with my purchase. The packaging used minimal plastic while also keep the card secure, something that I admired.During a time when we are moving more from physical copies of games to digital downloads this micro SD card will give you plenty of storage space for years to come!

I have had many memory cards over time.  Some are compatible with some products and some seem never to work in a Gopro.  However, I have never had a Samsung SD card not work in something.  They perform at the advertised speed without issue.  They work with everything and they keep working.  I've yet to have one fail.  I will keep buying Samsung EVO memory cards as long as I need them.

Well I got the SD card and put in the computer to format it and see that it is really only capable of 119 GB not the 128 GB claimed. Even after the format I don;t have full capacity of the card. These companies if they want to put BS software on the card need to make the card big enough to accommodate the program and still provide the customer with the advertised space available.

I ordered 4 of these.  I always put new SD cards through a couple of complete passes of a read/write/compare test.  The capacity was correct on all 4 cards (so, not obvious fakes), but 2 of the three failed the compare tests on both runs of the test.  A third failed on the second (and third) run.  Only the last card passed all test runs.I'm returning the 3 failing cards for a refund and will try a brand other than Samsung.  What is going on with these cards!?!

It was going to be used in a wyzecam pan we have for a baby monitor. I got busy with the new baby and everything else and forgot to return the item, missed the 30 day return window. Installed it in my phone, the phone formatted the card and immediately popped up:-"This SD card appears to be slow

A few things are important with micro-SD cards, and one biggie is write speed, especially for GoPro.  These are advertised as 95MB/s cards,  but in fact only the read speed is 95, the write speed is 20MB/s, which probably wont even work in a Hero 3.  GoPros can be sensitive, but I always try to buy cards with at least 90MB/s write speed.  I am returning the 5 I bought.
Device is defective. Tried it in my Android tablet: didnt work (corrupt) tried it in my windows 10 computer: same thing. Couldnt use anywhere
This is a very fast card suitable for high-resolution digital cameras that use the ".dng"or other RAW formats. I had originally purchased this to use in my Kobo H20 eReader,

As several other reviews have mention a few people have received counterfeit micro sd cards. I've never gotten on myself until now, at first the card worked great speeds were fantastic then I put the card in my fire tablet and I kept getting so many errors from generic IO errors to "storage not accessible" errors. My PNY micro sd card worked just fine in my fire tablet just not enough space, hence the reasons I purchased the 256gb samsung card. Now I've ordered a Sandisk Ultra 256gb micro sd card, I hope it's authentic and actually works.My samsung micro sd card was shipped and sold directly by Amazon. I'm not sure how amazon gets counterfeit products mixed in with their authentic stuff but it's definitely a problem I hope they'll address soon (even though they probably will not).

Edit 12/27/18 : I ran Crystal Disk Mark and although the R/W did improve for that particular test... it wasn't much, especially the read which is way below spec, write is just fine. I wonder what file type it actually reads up to 90.At the time of this review the 32GB card is selling for $5.99, and that is why it only loses 1 star instead of two.

I bought several of these chips specifically for use with my Towero 1080P Camera Glasses.  I've used several different brands of chips and have realized that not all chips are created equal.  The Toweros need a decent write speed in order to record smooth video.  The 32gig microSD chips with a 10mb/s write speed sometimes get freeze-frame for a few seconds, even though the sound doesn't skip.  THESE SAMSUNG CHIPS have a 20mb/s write speed and have had nothing but AWESOME video from them.So if you're using the Toweros -- THESE ARE THE CHIPS TO GET.
I have already purchased 5 of the EVO series of both 128 and 256 GB. I have used them on 4 different devices and they have performed flawlessly on all of them.DJI Osmo Action @4k60fps 100mbps
Not even including the price point in my opinion, these Wyze v2 cameras are amazing so far.Still tweaking the alert settings for motion & sound, but that's a matter of preference.

This was shipped and delivered as promised. And I think it is a good product - it works very good and it is fast. I would just give 5 stars to this product. However, the seller wanted actually to make it look like if it was manufactured in Korea, even though the original package says it was produced in Philippines. They just printed a sticker that says made in Korea and put it over the made in Philippines writing. I don't care where it was produced as long as the products have good QC. So, next time just be honest, Samsung!

I see some complaints about this not working in your camera or dashcam etc. for me it happened the same when I first plugged into my dash cam. however, after I formatted it with my dash cam and it works as it should. So I guess you need to format this with your devices since some electronics have sensitive side of it.

I purchased several of these 32Gb EVO microsSD cards for use in a smartphone, tablet, video camera, etc. My oldest one failed within four years and it was used to expand storage in a rarely used Amazon Fire tablet. All of the devices were just thrown away, but with the last one I decided to use the Samsung 10 year warranty. After Samsung closed my support request twice I gave up and will not buy another Samsung SD card. They just don’t last. For the price, I would consider them throw disposable.
Disappointed when i found out this card is slower than their card i bought 2 years ago.Back in 2018, i purchased the 128gb samsung evo select from amazon (MB-ME128GA/AM).

I'm a wedding photographer. Here is a comment I read on an industry forum just the other day:"Hey guys. Do any of you get really nervous formatting cards when you have back-to-back weddings? Like you get home after the first one, download all of your photos and make sure they are good, but then you have to format your cards for the next day? I hate that."

I bought the sd card for my car dash camera, but it kept on showing “can’t read the sd card”. However, the sd card was working when I putted the sd card to my Samsung camera!! Then, I tired to put the Samsung camera sd card back to car dash camera, it works too!!! Which means my car dash camera has no any problem here! I don’t know if I need to return it or keep it. Still thinking about it

I use this in my Canon EOSM 100 for video and pictures, and it works well. I have no issue with transfer speeds.  For example, an inordinate amount of time waiting to use the camera after I take a picture, or video.I can not quantify just how fast it is, but I can tell you I have no issues with this.  I like that it is Micro SD and I can use it in an application that takes micro SD or anywhere I use a standard SD card.

The product arrived, and seemed OK at first glance. Plugged it in, turned it on, and everything seemed fine.  I let the projector run for an hour, sometimes with an input, sometimes without.  The image quality was not bad. It was nowhere near the 3200 lumens advertised, however.  I'd guess maybe a quarter of that.Turned it off, then moved it to my living room.  The lamp started to flicker (off for a moment, then on for several seconds, repeating an an uneven interval).  Looking at the bottom of the projector, I saw a panel sticking up (not installed properly), and the screws holding it were stripped. If this is new, it was badly assembled.

I don't know why I waited so long to buy a microsd card but I'm so glad I did. I kept running out of space on my (Samsung) phone. Now I can transfer all my files like photos,  videos and documents to the microsd card while leaving space for all my apps.Pretty easy to install.
Purchased 5/2018, can no longer write to card 5/2020. ⭐⭐6/2020 update: Samsung stood behind their product and sent me a replacement. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Samsung micro SD cards are the only ones that I will ever purchase forever use in any of my devices and the best way to tell if a Samsung SD card is real is the complete outside rim of the card is white because white plastic cost more to produce than black plastic so you can tell it's a quality item also because SanDisk microSD cards are being flooded into the US market with fake ones from China and I've experienced that twice myself even once from Amazon so do your research before you buy an SD card and to top it off Samsung is one of the best cards out there again do your research

Memory prices have gotten even lower than I thought. $32 for 256GB is a steal! As with all Samsung cards I've ever used, this works flawlessly, and the SD adapter is still great. I use this card as "permanent" extra storage in my laptop, using a low profile PiDrive microSD adapter, and performance is still pretty good.I get 90MB/s read and 60MB/s write, which is a little less than what they advertise, though I got the same on a Samsung 64GB card with the same setup, so I might be limited by the adapter/port. Either way, the speed is fine, and I bought the card for its size, and it sure is big. I also verified the size with H2testw and it's all there, so no fake card here.

I have a handful of these. All tested with h2testw, all functional results and no fakes like some reviews mentioned thankfully. All my cards work well. This brand is slightly more expensive than others. I like that they automatically come with card reader.

I don't know why I always don't like Micro SD cards. The scams and generic always odd. This one however was nice. Work just fine but I suggest don't put "smiling white faces" on the package. Especially young ones, honesty I want the product not the people on it. Opening it was kinda self-destructive. Seems Samsung failed on packing on this one. But don't let that discourage you, the product is great so far.
my girlfriend was wanting more storage on her switch so I started searching.Gamestop prices are outrageous for sd cards and Walmart only had 64gig available.

I bought one for myself and it makes great videos. They're about two minutes long and then it starts another video. I would have given it five stars if it could hold a larger memory card and also if it had a usb plug in to the car. The old lighter plug is bulky and I have usb ports I could plug it into. I'll have to buy a separate cable for that. Other than this, this is a great product and I'm glad I have it. My daughter wanted one for her car because she saw some guy doing crazy stuff with his car wrecking it as he jumped over the median to the north bound side of the road, did a couple of circles and then sped off. She would have loved to have that on video. I would too.

I did a bit of research on the strengths and weaknesses of this type of device, and this unit was recommended by several respected sources as a good pairing for my Motorola Moto Z Play Droid phone.  I formatted the memory card to act as internal memory. I have not been disappointed. Before I got to this model I had tried different Brands/memory size/speed, but all others fell short of my expectation until now. I was so impressed by this Samsung EVO memory card's performance that l bought an additional unit for one of my secondary office phones. That should tell this audience something right there. You don't go back for seconds if the first left a bad taste in your mouth. I hope your experience with this Samsung EVO memory card turns out to be as good as mine.Thanks for reading. RC

I had another brand of Micro SD card which ended up corrupted and no longer functional. I tried formatting it on the phone and also on my desktop but nothing worked. I ended up ordering the Samsung Electronics EVO Select 256GB microSDXC and installing it in the phone. Installation was straight forward and took just a moment. It worked right away with no problems and now I will be able to save my pictures when I go traveling again.

I like these cards, especially because it is white. I know that might sound silly, but when you drop it between your car seats, and its black, it is very tough find. I have a couple from a brick and mortar location, that were very similar, and came looking for those. (they look the same but have a yellow bar instead of green one like there.They work fine, and I plan to start replacing my cards. with these as needed.
The 128GB version says 90 MB/s write...but the package I received and testd is only 60 MB/s.  There is another version of the EVO Plus (that ends in AM .. american?) that is actually 90 MB/s write.

I bought the 32GB, 64GB, 128GB and 256GB memory cards and all are working great. They all seem to be authentic and I verified all sizes using H2testw.Speeds are great and so far all of them are working reliably for the past 2 years.

As I unboxed the camera, I was impressed by the looks and finish.  I plugged it up and it immediately started saying "Waiting to Connect" as well as flashed a yellow light. I was immediately interrupted by a visitor and I had to unplug the camera to shut it up.  When I eventually plugged it back up, the blue light came on as if it was finished setting up.  The instructions said to use a paper clip to press the reset button on the back.  This didn't work.  After many attempts at pressing the button longer and longer, as well as power cycling the camera, I could not reset it.  I finally found a clue after searching the internet that said to download the new firmware to the sd card and restart it.  I did, but then it wouldn't power up at all.  After unplugging and replugging, I got the power to come back on briefly, but it went off again.  I left it plugged up about 5 minutes while I went on to something else.  When I picked the camera up again, I had my finger over the SD card slot with the card in it.  It was so hot it actually burned my finger.  I unplugged it and popped out the card.  It smelled like burned wires.  After working with this new camera for over an hour, it is now toast.  I have to wonder, if I had gotten it set up immediately with no interruptions would it have actually worked.

I recently purchased the base 256gb MacBook Air 2020 and got this 256gb SD card for storing documents, photos, and my backup copies for the Scrivener writing app. This approach was a lot less expensive than another $300 for a 512gb MacBook. Working out great so far. Read /write speeds seem to be pretty good. A happy customer.
Unfortunately after less than 15 months, the micro card became corrupt. I cannot format, I cannot delete anything and it will not capture new recordings.  Disappoiting.

Only 4 stars because im still waiting to see if it lasts more than a week or two. Will update if it changes.Tested and is a legitimate Samsung Evo microSD card and the storage is *mostly accurate. Even though formatting and other things alter the usable amount of storage, it seemed a little low, but not out of the range of an anomaly in production.

Used this in my Dashcam for 1 year this month. Had a hit and run incident today on my way to work and decided to pull the footage once I got home. The SD card is not recognized by any device/PC I put it into now. I have tried everything to get it to show up. I have pulled footage from it twice in the past and didn't have any problems. Now that I NEED it to come through, it has layed down on me. No more Samsung flash for me. I still have SD cards in the megabytes that still work. Mainly Sandisk. But this is just sad and really bad timing.

When getting these cards, know the SDHC format is Fat32 which can be useful to know if you don't own a computer because...As SDXC is a great choice since they allow more faster speeds and larger amount of space. The problem is that the format is Exfat which won't work for my reason unless I convert it which the tools are there because of generous people making the choice available.

I ordered two of these and one did not work in my camera. Amazon sent me a replacement and that one didn’t work either. I know it’s the memory card and not the camera because I have two cameras and I swapped the memory cards and the faulty one didn’t work and either camera but a good one worked in both cameras.  I’m going to try to return it but it’s so inconvenient but only one has worked and I have to get a memory card from somewhere else or risk ordering another one from here and have it also not work.

I bought two of these to use in mp3 player/speakers. I was able to put the music on the Samsung MicroSD card, but the player wouldn't read it from the card.The player reads SanDisk MicroSD cards, but not Samsung.

Can not access the unit now on multiple computers, multiple ways... Can not format or anything, does not show up at all in WINDOWS 10...  Tried CMD etc..  No dice...  DEAD...  Bought two, this one was in my car camera, and it finally stated no more room to write.... Bought for switch. Worked right out of the packaging, no format required.

it's what you expect. so far it's been used one day for music and emulation speed test. I'm not disappointed. I recommend any Samsung sd cards. I've been using them for years with no problems. all my originals still work

I have bought several of these Samsung EVO micro SD cards this year for new phones and tablets.  I was tempted by some lower priced brands, but I've been burned before by cheaper SD cards that went dead after a few months.  If you're backing everything up to the cloud constantly, I guess you could take a chance on something cheaper, but if you're not, don't risk losing your precious video and photo memories.  Spend a little more and get an authentic and dependable high speed SD.  Read and write speed are fantastic.  Additionally, these cards are moisture, heat, magnet, and xray resistant.

It's a memory card. It functions as expected. The price was too good to pass up. Only issue I had was the US mail carrier lied and said he delivered it when in fact her didn't deliver until the next day. It was obvious he lied to make it look like it was delivered on time when it wasn't. Amazon needs to stop using US mail and just deliver everything themselves.

I've used a variety of SD cards and Samsung SD cards have worked flawlessly.  I use the SD cards for burning Raspberry Pi images and often times other brands have a reduced capacity.  If I'm trying to burn a 128gb image I will usually receive an error on other cards indicating there's not enough space for the image.  Not with the Samsung!  These cards are worth the extra buck or two since I have no doubt they will handle image, perform well (read/write times), and not crap out after using them for a while.  Don't waste your time with no-name brands.

My SanDisk card was unable to be recognized by Win 8 laptop and Samsung Galaxy cell phone. Luckily there was no critical data on it but it was frustrating. Needed it for older Galaxy S3 that I was using as an mp3 player. Inserted the Samsung card and instantly was recognized and able to upload mp3 data. Also the available storage space looked to be what it was described as 32GB. I had read that when SanDisk fails in a Samsung phone that you should replace with a Samsung card. So far so good. And the price was about the same as any other name brand.

So glad i got the legit samsung card this time.  So many reviews saying about fake cards but this one is legit.  The packaging is retail and I test it in a Pc computer right away to make sure I get the full storage capacity.  This evo green version is not as fast as red but sufficient for dash cam continuous recording and security wifi cam.  I have these cards in the past about 2 years ago and they still work until this day.  I use this card in place of high endurance cards so I save a lot of money.  Even better when you buy it when it’s on sale.

Ordinarily, Samsung products are beyond reproach, but I have experienced two failures in two separate Samsung EVO 32GB microSD cards. Both died unexpectedly while seated in two different phones, neither of which had been subjected to unduly harsh treatment, and in both cases the corruption resulted in a 100% loss of all data that was saved on the card, which bummed me out big time because I use these things to hold my music library and my personal pictures in my phone, so there was some stuff on there that wasn't replaceable. I have decided to try out SanDisk's microSD cards for a while and see if I have any better luck.

When u do image burning on a card, max storage space matters and Samsung never fails on top of the quality and speed you get from this card. I bought a Pioneer card that was half the price and I was only getting 57 gig out 64 gig.  Samsung card I'm getting 59.9 gig out of 64 gig.  I could not fit my project in the Pioneer card and wasted my time.

So I bought this thinking it was a good deal for the money. Buyer beware. This is supposed to be a 256 GB and my phone reads it as 512gb. Not only that, as soon as I put this card into my phone it says it's already half full. So then I try and put it into my computer to check it out and format it. NOPE! Each one of my computers tells me to "close my apps there are to many open, need to free up space".  This must be some cheap knock off. Something is wrong with this as card. I should've just bought a Kensington like I wanted to from the beginning. Just beware. As soon as I can get my images from this memory card I'm sending it back.

Kinda pricey and difficult to justify$90 for one micro SD card. However, it's a great product, and it moves data very quickly much faster than their 256GB card. This is my 3rd Samsung Evo Select sd card they always have been the genuine thing no fakes. You can use the code on the back of the package to verify it's authenticity on their website. This may just be in my head but it does seem like it starts to slow down after a few months of use but like I said it may just be in my head. Overall it's a good product and I recommend buying it.

At the price point of this MicroSD card, you cannot​ go wrong. However, I want to make sure I cover a couple of items that may matter for some of the folks who are buying this for their dash-cam or Microsoft Surface.This card will fail consistently as so as it gets hot. I bought several of them so unless it is a batch issue, there is a technical issue with it.

Bought this for my MotoG5 phone and after formatting it I got a warning saying it was too slow for the phone so I threw in my old SanDisk Extreme instead. I don't know a lot about memory cards but the Samsung here is rated for 95mb/s and my SanDisk was only 90mb/s so I guess there is something else I'm missing. This is my mistake. I'm sure the card is great and now I have a spare for other application that require a microsd.

I received this SD card on time. I used it in my Galaxy S7 smartphone and it now provides lots of space to store my pictures, files, and other documents rather than on my phone itself. My only slight issue is that it apparently comes pre-formatted, so you do not get the entire stated storage capacity, but I am assuming that this is normal. So far I am very pleased with the performance and functionality of this card. I would buy it again if needed. Highly-recommend !!!

It was perfect for my dash cam... until I removed it, yet again, to take out a video with my iPhone (using that weird name adapter) and... Or inside the Maytag washing machine?? LOL

Even though Amazon recommends this MicroSD card with the YiHome Dome Camera, I have only had problems with this MicroSD card. Every few days it cannot read the card. When I used a Sandisk MicroSD card, I have had no read errors across 6 cameras.

I bought two of these MicroSD cards and one formatted fine and works great on my Fire tablet.The other I was trying to format the card and it's not recognized on either my windows or my Mac.  But when I pullled the MicroSD card out it burnt my fingers it was too hot to touch.  Returning this one for a replacement.  Now I wonder how long the other MicroSD card will work..... I purchase this memory for my digital camera, and I followed the camera's instructions, saying that I need to format the memory first. I formatted it, and it showed me the message 'Memory Error.' I contacted Amazon, and they sent a replacement, and I have the same issue with the replacement. I called them again, and the representative transferred me to technical support, which was worthless. The technical support didn't help at all.  I do not recommend this memory, at least in my case.

I have had scadisk memory cards and all have blown out so switch to Samsung and never had a problem yet. I though this might have been fake since sticker covered place of manufacturer. Called Amazon and they connect me Samsung directly who showed app that identify this as genuine. My sister says her phone works faster, I set Android to use memory card for extra memory and no problems. Samsung memory cards are only ones I use in all my devices.

USED ITEM!  Received used Samsung 256GB EVO card. Not in sealed retail packaging, in a ziplock bag for automotive license plate screws inside another plastic bag (see picture). Never accept memory that is not sealed. I paid for new, not used!

I added this card as internal memory on my Android phone.  It drastically slowed my phone down and had frequent issues.  Once the phone factory reset due to errors reading the card causing me to lose all my data (and usage of the phone at a very inconvenient time).  Replaced it with SanDisk extreme plus and the phone is so much faster and more stable.  This card is no good for a mobile device, especially formatted as internal memory.

I purchased this for use with my 4k action cam.  I've found that while the camera doesn't explicitly say that it requires the U3 high speed cards, when I use a U1 card with it and try to record 4k, sometimes the camera stutters, or simply won't record. I did a test one day with a U3 card that I already owned, and found that it recorded perfectly every time, and thus answered the question.I have been a fan of Samsung for years, and this is the second one of these I've purchased. I love the performance and price point on these cards. I will continue buying them as long as they are available and quality stays the same!

Tried to format it to run in a raspberry pi3. Could not format due to write protection and had no luck with the forums on trying to resolve this (little lock bottom, Regedit, diskchk, software apps...no luck) Basically was locked out of using it for what I thought was its intended purpose.

Samsung makes excellent digital storage, One of the few good ones, beware of no name microSD as well as usb sticks They are usually trash and the size stated is false and the memory is unstable. Generic names during searches like "panda" , "swan" and Gladstone, you will see a pattern. Do research on whatever you buy, if you just want to make a quick purchase, stick to the name brands: Samsung, Sandisk, Lexar, HP, PNY, Patriot, kingston, and Sony, SP or "Silicon Power" is not to bad on the low end.

Made the phone faster. Admittedly it's a cheap phone, but it still seemed to make the phone faster, more crisp. I've bought too many fake sd cards in the past, so now I only buy name brand. Trust me, spend the extra money. Personally, Samsung and Sandisk are my favorites.As far as size goes, 32gb is kind of a joke in today's digital age, but I bought it for my kid's phone so it's great for what I bought it for. This sd card does not disappoint.

Samsung micoSD cards are my “go to” storage solutions for camera, computer and now my Raspberry Pi4. The card performs perfectly and provides tons of space for writing OS images for my Pi4. I will definitely be buying more of these in the future, and highly recommend Samsung microSD for any application where you need the micro format (though you could use the adapter in the full size SD card format if necessary).

Bought a new tablet and wanted to add some extra memory. Considered getting one of the 256GB memory cards - but the 226GB was just a better deal. And really - 126GB is more than adequate for my media usage. The card works great - no issues installing it. Just needed to reformat it because the tablet said it needed to. More than pleased with my purchase.
I tested the 32gb cards and verified the results comply with the stated speeds and capacity. Check.The cards are authentic, as verified by comparing with sites that describe fake products. Check.

I was relived to find the sd card I received is genuine and legit.  Too many other sellers are selling knock off's and fakes.  I bought this card for a phone I preordered that will be in my hands on the 21st.  I ran the model code and upc numbers by a customer care tech on samsungs customer service phone number and the tech was able to verify it is real and genuine.

Item came soaking wet and smelling of laundry detergent as if it had gone through the wash. I am in need of it so against better judgement dried it off and inserted it and it appears to be working though only has 119gigs available on an advertised 128gig card. We'll see if it continues to work but I'm fairly certain it isn't designed to go through the wash regardless. Disappointing handling for sure.
Tested transfer rates and storage 100% Authentic. Samsung Original packaging. Works on my Samsung Galaxy S9(Micro SD card already in my cell phone.) so just took a screen shot of empty packaging.

I've lost count of how many of these cards I've bought over time. They work great for my cell phones and my tablets Android devices (Samsung Galaxy).However, for whatever reason, they only work 50% of the time for Dash Cams.

Using this in a DJI Osmo Action and it's been able to keep up in all shooting modes (up to 4K 60fps).  Other lower end micro SDXC cards that I've tested would cause the osmo action to throw a prompt that the SD card was too slow and the camera would refuse to record.  This card has been flawless and stable so far.  Enjoying the read and write speeds very much

I have actually ordered this same card twice now, not because it stopped working, but because it was such a good deal and it worked so well that I intentionally went back to find the same one that I had bought before.These are fast and have been completely reliable in my experience. The value is unparalleled, and with delivery by Amazon this is an obvious choice for me!

After 4 hours of trying to get the perfect video shot we had it! We celebrated. We watched the replay on the GoPro and we elated. When the replay finished we got an "SD Error" message. Got home and put SD card in the computer and it wouldn't even recognize it. Tried every recovery software possible but the disk isn't recognized by anything anymore.

I bought this card to use with my phone to increase my storage capacity. Unfortunately, some of my largest apps cannot be stored on the card but enough of them can be so that it really has helped increase the storage capacity on my phone.  Saving photos and videos to the card has also been a big benefit. I would definitely recommend this card.
Older phones have lower hard storage space and it can slow down the speed of the phone. Expanding storage on Android devices no matter the age of the phone definitely helped. Best price to gb point.

These samsung EVO and PRO microSD cards always come out on top when people test them for transfer speed and particularly random read access speed even amongst the best manufacturers.  The difference between a great card like these and a low quality card can mean a 10-fold difference in usable performance if you expect to repeatedly write and read from it.

Incorrectly cut, doesnt fit in slot. Poor quality control. Agreed to refund upon return. Needless inconvenient hassle. Time is valuable and should not be wasted on printing return labels and repackaging and returning faulty items, not to mention unreimbursed for loss of money on printer ink, paper, and gas. Happens way too frequently, becoming even more frequent as time goes on. Very disappointing.

I purchased this micro sd card for my Samsung Galaxy S5. I was able to install it in my phone quickly, however the instructions weren't very helpful but a quick search on the web helped me figure it out. My phone recognized the card right away, and I was able to move a bunch of pictures and music onto the card easily. I've had it for a few weeks now and haven't had any issues, so I'm happy with my purchase. The card was shipped quickly, arrived on time and was packaged well.

Disclaimer: I am a fan of Samsung products. That being said, I have used Samsung's MicroSD cards for my phones, cameras, and even my Nintendo Switch. I have never been disappointed nor have I had any issues with the products. This 256GB card sits in my Galaxy S10 and is a great reserve for my phone's camera and miscellaneous storage needs. I'd also say that the price is quite reasonable for the size.

Purchased bunch of SDCArds varying form 32 gbs to 128 gbs. All are class 10, that deliver faster read and write speed compared to lower classes. Its from Samsung, quality is solid, packaging is solid and comes with a micro sd card reader for laptop/PCs. I purchased it when it was on sale and got in a good price. Don't buy the unbranded or lower branded ones when you can get better quality from Samsung for the same price.

This is very good storage.  I have installed this in my Samsung Note 8 phone and it is working great.  Two very nice things about it is that it comes with the adapter and the card is already formatted and ready to use.

I use the Samsung EVO Select microSDs in everything that requires a microSD card.  From my GoPro Hero 8 Black recording in 4k to my security cameras to my dash cams.  Probably the hardest thing on them is running them in a dashcam.  They get incredibly hot, especially in Texas with the car in the hot sun.  They also get 1000's of rewrite cycles where its constantly recording and then getting the oldest videos rewritten to make room for the new videos, but I never have issues.  Great cards!

In a word, AMAZING! I own a Samsung J2 and and previously purchased a Kingston sd card, however the phone could not recognized it and sadly could never use it. I read on different blogs about different procedures you needed to performed on the phone in order to rooted and be able to use any sd card. Other option was to leave the phone on the technical department of my mobile service provider, but it took a whole week for them, so it was definitely not an option for me. I thought that since Samsung works better with Samsung devices, I should invest on a Samsung sd card. I got this one and my phone right away recognized it. Then I just format the sd card to start sending all my apps and info there and it worked flawlessly. It has been a lifesaver. I love it! It is so practical and worth it. My phone now works perfectly and I highly recommend this sd card to whomever wishes to expand the memory on your smartphone, and if you own a Samsung, get a Samsung sd card ;)

When I got the package, the device looked promising, so I opened it up and stuck it in my phone. I was met with an "unsupported SD card" message, so I figured it needed to be formatted first. My phone didn't want to format it for some reason, so I gave the card the benefit of the doubt and put it inside a PC instead. I was met with a message to format the card (no surprise) and proceeded to do a format. I even disabled quick format, and even then Windows refused to format the card.Maybe there's something else I'm missing here, but if I need to do an extensive amount of preparation and hurdle jumping to get a simple SD card to work, I'm assuming it's defective. Samsung is one of the leaders in storage quality, but for some reason I've had little luck with this particular SD card.

Got this for my Fiio M11 DAP.  I read somewhere online that this line (EVO Select) is the same as the other similar Samsung chip, but exclusive to Amazon so they can brand and price with advantage.  I got it, and it works great.  I have used about 50 gig and have hardly made a dent in the capacity.  Seems to perform as expected if not better.

i bought this for my sons Nintendo switch lite and it works perfectly . the SD cards made for the Nintendo specifically are wayyyyy over priced and this worked great ! my son is happy he can now play more games .

I don’t know why but I am receiving an error message when I put this SD card into a trail camera of mine. This is an absolute flawless piece of tech. Samsung highest rated cards are Evo Plus but the Select series is manufactured in the same factory and with the same tech. Currently running in a Samsung S20 Ultra 1TB as a photo storage for 4k and 8k videos. The read/write speeds are incredible and love the price.

I absolutely hate using this camera!!!! The manual was difficult for setup, luckily I went back to the reviews and saw that they had a video on YouTube. I have been patient with this device since September 21, 2018. The video on YouTube was a success and it was a lot easier to setup. Once the camera was online and I switch from the app and start using my phone for other things retrieving the live video would be difficult, each time I switch back to the app to see the video it would be loading or trying to connect or reconnecting. Then it went off line, this happen every day I tried using the camera. I then decided to leave the app open to see the video without exiting the app and it work! It stayed online the entire time. If I have to leave the app open and not used my phone then I dont want it. Not only was the camera jumping off line when i exit the app but the blue and red light was sooooo!!! Bright even when i cover them with tape you could still see in the dark and the camera would get ready hot. Am returning this camera it was a waste of my time.

I got this for my Nvidia shield tv. I have the regular tube version, it accepts a micro sd card for extra storage. I’ve tried multiple brands for cameras, phones, the switch, the 3ds, and general storage but the Samsung micro as cards are just far better than the competitors, the read and write  speeds are better than other brands and I’ve never had an issue while Sandisk has had defective cards and reading errors.I’ll never buy another brand and after several cards purchased in sure I’ll buy many more.

I bought 2 of Samsung 32GB 95MB/s (U1) MicroSD EVO card for my Mavic platinum and my dash cam, but when I tested, it did not show me the speed or close the the speed they state in the advertiser. when I record in 4K from my mavic it did not give the clear video like from my samsung 64GB. Both packaging and appearance are representative of the value, no problems installing it both in a phone and a camera, although I do not normally will do this I needed additional storage in my camera in a hurry and made the swich seamlessly and very little back and forth.I can recommend the product with no reserves.

Keeps your data safe and secure. You know if you put it on here it will be here when you need it. I got one of those fake SD cards at Christmas that my daughter bought on eBay. It was supposed to be 64GB and she put it in her phone, transferred all her pictures to the card and deleted them from her phone. Sadly she lost 12 GB of her photos as the card was really only a 1GB card that had been designed to look like a 64GB. She got her money back from eBay, but the photos are gone forever. Here on Amazon I haven't had any problems. Every SD card I have ever purchased was exactly what it was supposed to be.

I bought this to replace the factory Samsung micro sd card that came with my Galaxy S7 since it was going bad. The original card was unmounting over 100x throughout the day, killing my battery. I did a quick format of the new EVO sd on my computer and loaded all the files from the old card in about 30min for roughly 18GB of data. The EVO certainly performed much better than the original card. The overall write speed was about 12-16MB/s which is not as high as I had hoped but much better than the sub-10MB of the previous card.Overall, I am very pleased with this card. It performs well and fixed the issue I had that was draining my battery.

Worked well in a dash cam (main going forward use) and used it in a canon t5i to test it out. Did burst mode faster than other cards I've used on my Canon. Higher read and write for the storage capacity for high i/o demand devices. Adapter worked for what it needed to. For the value of it I'm most likely going to buy another and use this as my go to for now.

After installing this card on my brand new Samsung Galaxy A01, to my surprise, it only showed 238.5 GB available.  There is nothing stored in the card;  7.5 MB was used for formating.  Therefore, this card's storage capacity is only 238.5 GB, not 256 as described.  I wonder whether I got a defected card.  I have tried to contact the seller, but there wasn't an option.  It is not "ultra-fast" as it claimed.
Too many photos on my phone really slowed up the phone. Popped this into the phone and moved all my pictures onto it and the phone is operating perfectly again.Wonderful and easy to use.

I ordered three of these.  One has gone bad after several months of use in an interior security camera .  Went thru the procedure to get an exchange and an RMA number.  Unfortunately, to get the RMA number I was directed to a company called Silicon Power - which has nothing to do with Samsung!?!?  Not sure what to think.  At this point I seem to have no options for contacting Amazon or Samsung to get a replacement for this defective microSD card.

The transfer/write speeds are what is typically marketed as the feature for SD cards, and what's listed on the card face. Samsung deliberately took advantage by saying in the product title "95MB/s" which by people who are familiar with SD cards, would be the write speed. When you're using for taking pictures or transferring files, the write speed is the most important factor. Then the product description lists  "95mb/s and 20MB/s read and write" speeds, deliberately separating them instead of listing them as 95MB/s read and 20MB/s write. This is complete crap and I won't order SD cards from Samsung again. Again, this is deliberately poor marketing.

Fast card, going to use it to increase storage on an old Macbook Air. Can you believe the Macbook Air only came with 128GB storage, totally not enough so this tiny microSD card will effectively triple my existing storage. Got an adapter from BaseQi, it goes into the Macbook Air's SD card slot, flush, and has matching aluminum bezel.
Compatible with my device as it was described. Great quality from Samsung didn’t disappoint me.Fast speed and reading as advertised.

my son installed it in my phone. It registere 29 gb. I thought great now ill have plenty of memory. Everyday I would check it and it never used memory. I still thought this will last a long time. My quick memo app died. I have no internel memory left???? Plugged it into lap top and it didnt even register????? Im disgusted

Works generally as well as most other class 10 cards. It certainly is not mind-blowingly fast, regardless of what the benchmarks (or reviewers) tell you. In real-world performance (i.e. everyday file copy operations), it does around 10 MB/s writes, and that's what it is rated to do. I've never seen it do the claimed 20 MB/s. So, it performs as expected and so far has been a solid workhorse. Longevity will be the real benchmark.

I've been running this in my Tinkerboard (Single Board Computer kind of like a Raspberry Pi) and it's been doing great, I've went through a lot of different SD cards for Pis and eventually they would corrupt and not boot, this has been running steady for almost 2 years now. The read/write speeds are great for this application and I'm running a webserver on it (serving 2 domains) so it's reading files a lot and serving them up.

This works well. The thing is, you must be aware that all these mini sd cards all say one number of storage space, but that is not what you get. It differs for each brand, but this one it says 512GB but you only get about 460GB.  Just so you are aware. It's still a good price for 460GB actual storage space.

Never written a review, so here goes... Got this camera to video my son's volleyball matches and wanted HD or 4K. But, didn't want to spend the money on GoPro.  Watched a plethora of YouTube videos on cheaper action cams. Felt pretty good about features to look for and what to expect in rendering the video to publish. It was a little tricky getting it set up and getting all the settings how I wanted. But, the OS on the camera isn't bad and if you mess up a video, erase it and try something else. I did put in a 64 Gb card instead of the 32 Gb. Formatted fine, but I have shot enough to fill it up. So I don't know if it only stores up to 32 Gb, which is what I read in other reviews.  The only complaint is the sticky battery cover. Hard to get off. I had to use a knife to get this off and it scratched the bottom. But, glad it is really on there so the battery doesn't come out! The video is awesome and putting the footage in Movie Maker 10 is super easy. I think I'll probably use Adobe to get more editing features. But, great camera and the quality is really good. This might not be for a person who just wants it to work, though. But with trying out different settings, you'll get it how you want. It is a great camera!

I use 3 indoor and 2 outdoor WYZE cameras. The installation was simple, the direction were clear and concise. The picture quality is fantastic the voice communication has a bit of a lag. But, all in all a wonderful value.Other cameras require you to purchase a hub. Wyze does not, so that is a bonus.

I'm sure these are fine for everyday use.  I bought this specifically for use in a Raspberry Pi.  I should have read the benchmark reviews first.  This card was the slowest U-1 card reviewed.  So I'm using it in a low-power netbook for extra storage.  Well, one of the two I bought anyway...I snapped one in half trying to get it out of the RPi4 I used it in because of poor case design.

I turned on the Kindle this morning and it doesn't even recognize it.  Tried resetting the Kindle, tried taking it out and putting it back in but it still doesn't recognize it. Computer won’t reformat or  recognize it either. Unusable now.So, it's going back and I will buy another brand...Don't know if this SD card will work with other electronics but it's a big "THUMBS DOWN" for me...

Wow.  256 GB on a micro sd card from Samsung.  Seems to work well to increase storage for my son's Surface tablet. I now have to order another for me. Bought Samsung 256gb Evo card, ran test on card and it tested as a real 256gb card with no errors and speeds of just under the advertised numbers which is acceptable for this card. Great price for this card. Last one I bought from eBay was a fraud and did not pass test. Would by from again. Very pleased.

The reason that I'm posting a review is really less about the MicroSD card itself than about how little information is available on Roku's MicroSD card requirements, so I was unsure whether this card would work when I ordered it.  The Samsung 32GB 95MB/s (U1) MicroSD EVO card was recognized and formatted by the Roku without any problems, so I'm pleased.  Apparently, as little as 2GB capacity would have worked fine, but the price of this card was low enough that I opted to buy one with reserve capacity should a future software update change things.

As a content creator Marlee December on YouTube, these SD cards are the perfect extra storage for my Samsung Galaxy S9. I am able to record vlogs and store pictures on the card for future use. Can’t go wrong with this card. It works flawless.

First card arrived defective but Amazon quickly replaced it.  2nd worked fine, but unfortunately my phone would only allow me to move limited files to the card, so memory remains a problem. I bought this to expand the capacity of my refurbished samsung galaxy s9+ phone that I also bought on Amazon. The pairing is perfect! **This product review was written for the Samsung 32GB 95MB/s (U1) MicroSD EVO Select Memory Card with Adapter (MB-ME32GA/AM) sold by SAMSUNG.The packaging is cute and easy to open. Great SD card for my twin's tablets. They have more storage space for their schoolwork, along with better speed for their games.Shipping was phenomenal, too!

I bought this Samsung Evo 32GB for my GoPro and my Digicam.  It perform better than what its rated, V10 and U1 class 10 spec has a minimum write speed of at least 10 Mbyte/s, which is what you need for 1080p recording.  I ran several SD card speed test with my computer and I get a speed on average of 35Mb/s Write and 92 Mb/s read.  At over 30Mb/s this card should be rated v30 and U3, also to note over 30mb/s minimum is 4K HD video recording ready....

Bought this card for my GoPro Hero 5 Black made shots all day long and when transferring from card reader to my Mac at about 85% done it crash and I lost the last shots of my session. Software recovery recalls this card as posible fake card

There are so many microsd cards with so many different prices. I had to go with Samsung and not risk it. I installed it into my note 20 ultra phone and it was immediately recognized at almost full capacity.

I just bought the 32 gb to use in my Samsung J7 from Virgin Mobile. So far it is awesome and I would recommend it!  I did NOT have to wipe it and integrate it as part of the internal storage. I just opened the package, turned off my phone, put the card in the sd compartment, and turned my phone back on. Ready to use, simple as that. It worked like a charm to transfer my photos and files to and so far I've been successful at transferring several apps to it as well. (Go into settings>apps>select the app to transfer>storage> change/move to external. If change/move button does not show up, that means it is not an option to store it on external drive) Not all apps allow you to place them on external memory. It is not a fault of the sd card. Super happy for the price I payed this is a good deal!

So far this card has lasted a long time, Samsung is a great company, I've bought several SanDisk that all died in under a month and the company didn't care. They didn't reimburse me, replace, or even reply to my complaints. I don't recall exactly when I purchased this but it was more than 3 months ago, possibly 6 months to a year. It works great still. I fully recommend Samsung over the other and will likely purchase Samsung in the future.
my wife needed more storage on her phone, so after having my memory card from years now i had to buy the same one to her, i know it will last a really long time

I changed my camera twice, thought that there may be some problem with my camera but still i see the issue that playback is not working and it shows only lines when i try to play my recorded video or images. It means that read capacity of this card is very slow. I requested for replacement.

Looking for extra space for your samsung phone? definitely go with a samsung micro sd for it then, don't buy a knockoff from wish or some other site, go for the name brand, trust me you don't want to lose pictures with the competitors card, I wish it could have been bigger capacity, but with my phone and the amount of memory on phones now its extra space for your music, videos, or whatever.

I've bought several of these to use in my phone, my tablet, my GoPro camera, and in my dashcam. The speeds are good enough to record 4K video, and these have a pretty good price for the capacity.  I never use the MicroSD to SD adapter card - if it were up to me I wouldn't include it in the package.

As others have observed, the claimed write speeds for the 128GB card are not anywhere near what I am actually getting. Actual observed write speeds with multiple 128GB cards is 18-20Mbps, not the claimed 60MBps, and that's with sequential zeros. Read speeds are up to 85MBps on my fastest adapter.

I've used a whole ton of models of micro SD cards. I keep a bunch of Android phones and various cameras online at all times, so I use quite a lot of these. Samsung Evo is the only brand of sd storage that has never corrupted photos on me. Every other card has let me down, but not Evo. And this series is the best of the Evo cards. You get great high speed performance out of them. If you have a problem with these I guarantee the problem is with your reader's hardware, because there are no problems ever with these cards.

I don't skimp when it comes to data storage, not that the Samsung price is all that expensive, but the quality of the brand ensures that I don't lose my data. Whether it's pictures, videos, or audio files these memory cards have worked exceedingly well for me and I've never had any issues with them. I use them in cameras, phones, and digital voice recorders all the time.
